LanguageData.AlcoholHigh.label: alcohol
LanguageData.AlcoholHigh.description: Alcohol in the bloodstream. It makes people happy, but reduces capacities.
LanguageData.AlcoholHigh.stages.0.label: warm
LanguageData.AlcoholHigh.stages.1.label: tipsy
LanguageData.AlcoholHigh.stages.2.label: drunk
LanguageData.AlcoholHigh.stages.3.label: hammered
LanguageData.AlcoholHigh.stages.4.label: blackout
LanguageData.Hangover.label: hangover
LanguageData.Hangover.description: An unpleasant delayed after-effect of alcohol intoxication.
LanguageData.Hangover.stages.0.label: slight
LanguageData.Hangover.stages.1.label: strong
LanguageData.Hangover.stages.2.label: pounding
LanguageData.AlcoholTolerance.label: alcohol tolerance
LanguageData.AlcoholTolerance.description: A built-up tolerance to alcohol. The more severe this tolerance is, the more alcohol it takes to get the same effect.
LanguageData.AlcoholAddiction.label: alcohol addiction
LanguageData.AlcoholAddiction.description: A chemical addiction to alcohol. Long-term presence of alcohol has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without the drug. \nWithout regular doses of alcohol, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.
LanguageData.AlcoholAddiction.stages.1.label: withdrawal
LanguageData.AmbrosiaHigh.label: ambrosia warmth
LanguageData.AmbrosiaHigh.description: Ambrosia chemicals in the bloodstream. It lifts the mood.
LanguageData.AmbrosiaTolerance.label: ambrosia tolerance
LanguageData.AmbrosiaTolerance.description: A built-up tolerance to ambrosia. The more severe this tolerance is, the more ambrosia it takes to get the same effect.
LanguageData.AmbrosiaAddiction.label: ambrosia addiction
LanguageData.AmbrosiaAddiction.description: A chemical addiction to ambrosia. Long-term presence of ambrosia has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without the drug. \nWithout regular doses of ambrosia, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.
LanguageData.AmbrosiaAddiction.stages.1.label: withdrawal
LanguageData.GoJuiceHigh.label: high on go-juice
LanguageData.GoJuiceHigh.description: Go-juice in the bloodstream. It supercharges combat-related abilities, and instantly increases psyfocus when first injected.
LanguageData.GoJuiceAddiction.label: go-juice addiction
LanguageData.GoJuiceAddiction.description: A chemical addiction to go-juice. Long-term presence of go-juice has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without the drug. \nWithout regular doses of go-juice, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.
LanguageData.GoJuiceAddiction.stages.1.label: withdrawal
LanguageData.GoJuiceTolerance.stages.0.label: small
LanguageData.GoJuiceTolerance.stages.1.label: large
LanguageData.GoJuiceTolerance.stages.2.label: massive
LanguageData.GoJuiceTolerance.label: go-juice tolerance
LanguageData.GoJuiceTolerance.description: A built-up tolerance to go-juice. The more severe this tolerance is, the more go-juice it takes to get the same effect.
LanguageData.LuciferiumHigh.label: luciferium
LanguageData.LuciferiumHigh.description: Active luciferium mechanites in the body. They improve the body's functioning in all respects. However, if they are not regularly replenished with more doses of luciferium, they lose cohesion and drive the user insane.
LanguageData.LuciferiumAddiction.label: luciferium need
LanguageData.LuciferiumAddiction.description: Luciferium mechanites in the body. Luciferium mechanites decohere over time; only regular doses of fresh luciferium can prevent this process. \nWithout luciferium, the mechanite decoherence will reach a critical state, causing the victim to go insane and die.
LanguageData.LuciferiumAddiction.stages.1.label: unmet
LanguageData.PenoxycylineHigh.label: penoxycyline
LanguageData.PenoxycylineHigh.description: Penoxycyline-induced immunity to certain illnesses. This only blocks new infections; it does nothing for those who are already infected, even if their infection is dormant.
LanguageData.FlakeHigh.label: high on flake
LanguageData.FlakeHigh.description: Active flake in the bloodstream. Generates a euphoric, debilitating high.
LanguageData.PsychiteTeaHigh.label: high on psychite tea
LanguageData.PsychiteTeaHigh.description: Active psychite tea in the bloodstream. Generates a mild euphoric effect.
LanguageData.YayoHigh.label: high on yayo
LanguageData.YayoHigh.description: Active yayo in the bloodstream. Generates an intense euphoric high.
LanguageData.PsychiteTolerance.stages.0.label: small
LanguageData.PsychiteTolerance.stages.1.label: large
LanguageData.PsychiteTolerance.stages.2.label: massive
LanguageData.PsychiteTolerance.label: psychite tolerance
LanguageData.PsychiteTolerance.description: A built-up tolerance to psychite. The more severe this tolerance is, the more psychite-based drugs like yayo or flake it takes to get the same effect.
LanguageData.PsychiteAddiction.label: psychite addiction
LanguageData.PsychiteAddiction.description: A chemical addiction to psychite. Long-term presence of psychite has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without the drug. \nWithout regular doses of psychite from drugs like flake or yayo, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.
LanguageData.PsychiteAddiction.stages.1.label: withdrawal
LanguageData.SmokeleafHigh.label: stoned on smokeleaf
LanguageData.SmokeleafHigh.description: Smokeleaf's active chemical in the bloodstream. Generates a soft feeling of fuzzy well-being.
LanguageData.SmokeleafTolerance.stages.0.label: small
LanguageData.SmokeleafTolerance.stages.1.label: large
LanguageData.SmokeleafTolerance.stages.2.label: massive
LanguageData.SmokeleafTolerance.label: smokeleaf tolerance
LanguageData.SmokeleafTolerance.description: A built-up tolerance to smokeleaf. The more severe this tolerance is, the more smokeleaf it takes to get the same effect.
LanguageData.SmokeleafAddiction.label: smokeleaf dependence
LanguageData.SmokeleafAddiction.description: A chemical addiction to smokeleaf. Long-term use of smokeleaf has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without the drug. \nWithout regular doses of smokeleaf, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.
LanguageData.SmokeleafAddiction.stages.1.label: withdrawal
LanguageData.WakeUpHigh.label: high on wake-up
LanguageData.WakeUpHigh.description: Wake-up in the bloodstream. It fills the need for rest by stimulating the brain, and increases focus, allowing faster work. It also increases the psyfocus gains from meditation.
LanguageData.WakeUpAddiction.label: wake-up addiction
LanguageData.WakeUpAddiction.description: A chemical addiction to wake-up. Long-term presence of wake-up has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without the drug. \nWithout regular doses of wake-up, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.
LanguageData.WakeUpAddiction.stages.1.label: withdrawal
LanguageData.WakeUpTolerance.stages.0.label: small
LanguageData.WakeUpTolerance.stages.1.label: large
LanguageData.WakeUpTolerance.stages.2.label: massive
LanguageData.WakeUpTolerance.label: wake-up tolerance
LanguageData.WakeUpTolerance.description: A built-up tolerance to wake-up. The more severe this tolerance is, the more wake-up it takes to get the same effect.
LanguageData.BloodLoss.label: blood loss
LanguageData.BloodLoss.description: A reduction in the normal blood volume. Minor blood loss has relatively mild effects, but when blood loss becomes severe, oxygen transport becomes badly impaired and the victim loses the ability to move. Extreme blood loss leads to death. \nBlood loss naturally recovers over time as the body slowly regenerates its blood supply.
LanguageData.BloodLoss.stages.0.label: minor
LanguageData.BloodLoss.stages.1.label: minor
LanguageData.BloodLoss.stages.2.label: moderate
LanguageData.BloodLoss.stages.3.label: severe
LanguageData.BloodLoss.stages.4.label: extreme
LanguageData.Anesthetic.label: anesthetic
LanguageData.Anesthetic.description: Sleep drugs in the bloodstream. Anesthetic renders creatures unconscious.
LanguageData.Anesthetic.stages.0.label: wearing off
LanguageData.Anesthetic.stages.1.label: woozy
LanguageData.Anesthetic.stages.2.label: sedated
LanguageData.CatatonicBreakdown.label: catatonic breakdown
LanguageData.CatatonicBreakdown.description: A state of mental shock which leads to a total inability to function. The victim collapses, effectively unconscious.
LanguageData.PsychicShock.label: psychic shock
LanguageData.PsychicShock.description: A state of psychic chaos in the brain and mind. Caused by psychic attacks or critical level of neural heat, this effect is debilitating until it wears off.
LanguageData.PsychicComa.label: psychic coma
LanguageData.PsychicComa.description: A form of benign coma during which the brain recovers from a psychic overload.
LanguageData.PsychicHangover.label: psychic hangover
LanguageData.PsychicHangover.description: An after-effect of neural heat. Psychic hangover is bothersome, but not dangerous.
LanguageData.PsychicHangover.stages.0.label: forming
LanguageData.PsychicHangover.stages.1.label: buzzing
LanguageData.BrainShock.label: brain shock
LanguageData.BrainShock.description: After-effects of an electrical shock to the brain. This is generally cause by feedback from brain implants hit by EMP pulses.
LanguageData.CryptosleepSickness.label: cryptosleep sickness
LanguageData.CryptosleepSickness.description: After-effects of using a cryptosleep pod. Cryptosleep suspends and replaces many bodily functions in order to prevent aging and death. Upon exiting cryptosleep, the body takes time to restart and rebalance its natural metabolic processes. While this is ongoing, the patient suffers from nausea, dizziness, and a sense of fuzziness in the mind.
LanguageData.FoodPoisoning.label: food poisoning
LanguageData.FoodPoisoning.description: Gastrointestinal illness caused by consuming decayed or unclean food. It can be caused by eating rotten food, by incompetent cooks accidentally poisoning meals, or by eating from unsafe wild sources. The patient will vomit and feel sick for some time.
LanguageData.FoodPoisoning.stages.0.label: recovering
LanguageData.FoodPoisoning.stages.1.label: major
LanguageData.FoodPoisoning.stages.2.label: initial
LanguageData.ToxicBuildup.label: toxic buildup
LanguageData.ToxicBuildup.description: Poison in the bloodstream. This can come from various sources, including environmental toxins, venomous bites, or poisoned weapons. \nAt high doses, toxic buildup is lethal. Even at low doses, it can generate cancers. \nCreatures who die with toxic buildup cannot be eaten.
LanguageData.ToxicBuildup.stages.0.label: initial
LanguageData.ToxicBuildup.stages.1.label: initial
LanguageData.ToxicBuildup.stages.2.label: minor
LanguageData.ToxicBuildup.stages.3.label: moderate
LanguageData.ToxicBuildup.stages.4.label: serious
LanguageData.ToxicBuildup.stages.5.label: extreme
LanguageData.Pregnant.label: pregnant
LanguageData.Pregnant.description: This creature is gestating offspring. It will give birth if the pregnancy comes to term. If starved or injured, there may be a miscarriage.
LanguageData.Pregnant.stages.0.label: early-stage
LanguageData.Pregnant.stages.1.label: middle-stage
LanguageData.Pregnant.stages.2.label: late-stage
LanguageData.HeartAttack.label: heart attack
LanguageData.HeartAttack.description: A disruption in the heart's normal beating rhythm. Heart attacks can be debilitatingly painful. They can worsen and lead to death, or recover.
LanguageData.HeartAttack.stages.0.label: painful
LanguageData.HeartAttack.stages.1.label: debilitating
LanguageData.HeartAttack.stages.2.label: fatal
LanguageData.DrugOverdose.label: drug overdose
LanguageData.DrugOverdose.description: Generalized toxic effects due to over-concentration of drugs in the bloodstream.
LanguageData.DrugOverdose.stages.0.label: minor
LanguageData.DrugOverdose.stages.1.label: minor
LanguageData.DrugOverdose.stages.2.label: major
LanguageData.ResurrectionSickness.label: resurrection sickness
LanguageData.ResurrectionSickness.description: After-effects of being resurrected by mechanite injection. Artificially-kickstarted body processes take time to rebalance themselves.
LanguageData.Malnutrition.label: malnutrition
LanguageData.Malnutrition.description: Abnormally low body fat and weight, typically caused by lack of food. Malnutrition is always very unpleaseant, but its initial effects are mild. Without food, though, a malnourished creature will waste away, losing muscle mass and capacities. Malnutrition ends with death. \nUpon re-feeding malnutrition naturally recovers over time. Malnourished creatures have larger appetites than normal.
LanguageData.Malnutrition.stages.0.label: trivial
LanguageData.Malnutrition.stages.1.label: minor
LanguageData.Malnutrition.stages.2.label: moderate
LanguageData.Malnutrition.stages.3.label: severe
LanguageData.Malnutrition.stages.4.label: extreme
LanguageData.Heatstroke.label: heatstroke
LanguageData.Heatstroke.description: A generalized disruption to body functioning caused by excessive exposure to heat and sun. The victim becomes dizzy, weak, and confused. Recovery is quick once in a cool area, but if heat exposure continues, heat stroke gets worse until death.
LanguageData.Heatstroke.stages.0.label: initial
LanguageData.Heatstroke.stages.1.label: initial
LanguageData.Heatstroke.stages.2.label: minor
LanguageData.Heatstroke.stages.3.label: serious
LanguageData.Heatstroke.stages.4.label: extreme
LanguageData.Hypothermia.label: hypothermia
LanguageData.Hypothermia.description: Dangerously low core body temperature. Unless re-warmed, hypothermia gets worse and ends in death. Recovery is quick once the victim is re-warmed. Avoid hypothermia by wearing warm clothes in cold environments.
LanguageData.Hypothermia.stages.0.label: shivering
LanguageData.Hypothermia.stages.1.label: shivering
LanguageData.Hypothermia.stages.2.label: minor
LanguageData.Hypothermia.stages.3.label: serious
LanguageData.Hypothermia.stages.4.label: extreme
LanguageData.HypothermicSlowdown.label: hypothermic slowdown
LanguageData.HypothermicSlowdown.description: A special biological state used by some creatures to survive extreme cold. Instead of trying to stay warm, the creature's body chemistry adapts to prevent internal freezing despite very low temperature. Bodily functions are slowed and capacities are reduced, but the cold does no permanent damage. Some biologists call it a wakeful form of hibernation.
LanguageData.HypothermicSlowdown.stages.0.label: minor
LanguageData.HypothermicSlowdown.stages.1.label: minor
LanguageData.HypothermicSlowdown.stages.2.label: moderate
LanguageData.HypothermicSlowdown.stages.3.label: serious
LanguageData.HypothermicSlowdown.stages.4.label: extreme
LanguageData.BadBack.label: bad back
LanguageData.BadBack.description: Degradation in the spinal column and surrounding musculature. This makes it hard to move and bend smoothly.
LanguageData.Frail.label: frail
LanguageData.Frail.description: Generalized loss of muscle and bone density.
LanguageData.Cataract.label: cataract
LanguageData.Cataract.description: Milky-looking opacity in the eye. Cataracts impair vision.
LanguageData.Blindness.label: blindness
LanguageData.HearingLoss.label: hearing loss
LanguageData.HearingLoss.description: Inability to hear quiet sounds due to degradation of hair cells in the cochlea.
LanguageData.Dementia.label: dementia
LanguageData.Dementia.description: Neural degradation which causes deficits in the ability to think and remember. Dementia has various causes including aging, specific illnesses, and toxins.
LanguageData.Alzheimers.label: alzheimer's
LanguageData.Alzheimers.description: A brain disease usually associated with aging. Alzheimer's disease causes progressive degradation in the ability to think and remember. Patients are known to forget close relatives and sometimes wander around in confusion.
LanguageData.Alzheimers.stages.0.label: minor
LanguageData.Alzheimers.stages.1.label: minor
LanguageData.Alzheimers.stages.2.label: major
LanguageData.Alzheimers.stages.3.label: major
LanguageData.Asthma.label: asthma
LanguageData.Asthma.description: A long-term inflammatory disease of the airways in the lungs. It requires regular tending to prevent symptoms.
LanguageData.Asthma.stages.0.label: minor
LanguageData.Asthma.stages.1.label: major
LanguageData.Asthma.stages.2.label: major
LanguageData.HeartArteryBlockage.label: artery blockage
LanguageData.HeartArteryBlockage.description: A blockage in one of the critical arteries in the heart. Heart artery blockages randomly induce heart attacks.
LanguageData.HeartArteryBlockage.stages.0.label: minor
LanguageData.HeartArteryBlockage.stages.1.label: minor
LanguageData.HeartArteryBlockage.stages.2.label: major
LanguageData.HeartArteryBlockage.stages.3.label: major
LanguageData.HeartArteryBlockage.stages.4.label: extreme
LanguageData.Carcinoma.label: carcinoma
LanguageData.Carcinoma.description: A lump of cancerous tissue. Without treatment, the carcinoma will grow over time, causing worsening symptoms and eventually killing the patient. \nA skilled doctor can excise the carcinoma. An unskilled doctor may be able to simply amputate the body part which contains the carcinoma.
LanguageData.Carcinoma.stages.0.label: minor
LanguageData.Carcinoma.stages.1.label: minor
LanguageData.Carcinoma.stages.2.label: major
LanguageData.Carcinoma.stages.3.label: major
LanguageData.Carcinoma.stages.4.label: extreme
LanguageData.Carcinoma.stages.5.label: extreme
LanguageData.GutWorms.label: gut worms
LanguageData.GutWorms.description: Parasitic worms in the gut. They cause vomiting. They also consume the victim's food, which increases hunger.
LanguageData.MuscleParasites.label: muscle parasites
LanguageData.MuscleParasites.description: Parasitic creatures in the muscles. These cause weakness and a lack of coordination.
LanguageData.FibrousMechanites.label: fibrous mechanites
LanguageData.FibrousMechanites.description: Semi-coherent mechanites which develop fibrous links in muscle tissue. They enhance the victim's strength, but also cause intense pain. These are probably a mutated strain of strength-enhancing mechanites.
LanguageData.FibrousMechanites.stages.0.label: mild pain
LanguageData.FibrousMechanites.stages.1.label: intense pain
LanguageData.SensoryMechanites.label: sensory mechanites
LanguageData.SensoryMechanites.description: Semi-coherent mechanites which reside in the nervous system. They enhance the victim's senses, but also cause intense pain. These are probably a mutated strain of sense-enhancing mechanites.
LanguageData.SensoryMechanites.stages.0.label: mild pain
LanguageData.SensoryMechanites.stages.1.label: intense pain
LanguageData.WoundInfection.label: infection
LanguageData.WoundInfection.description: Bacterial infection in a wound. Without treatment, the bacteria will multiply, killing local tissue, and eventually causing blood poisoning and death. \nThrough aeons of human warfare, infections have often taken more lives than the wounds themselves.
LanguageData.WoundInfection.stages.0.label: minor
LanguageData.WoundInfection.stages.1.label: major
LanguageData.WoundInfection.stages.2.label: extreme
LanguageData.WoundInfection.stages.3.label: extreme
LanguageData.Flu.label: flu
LanguageData.Flu.description: An infectious disease caused by the influenza virus.
LanguageData.Flu.stages.0.label: minor
LanguageData.Flu.stages.1.label: major
LanguageData.Flu.stages.2.label: extreme
LanguageData.Animal_Flu.label: flu
LanguageData.Animal_Flu.description: An infectious disease caused by the influenza virus. This strain is adapted for infecting non-human species.
LanguageData.Animal_Flu.stages.0.label: minor
LanguageData.Animal_Flu.stages.1.label: major
LanguageData.Animal_Flu.stages.2.label: extreme
LanguageData.Plague.label: plague
LanguageData.Plague.description: An infectious disease caused by bacteria.
LanguageData.Plague.stages.0.label: minor
LanguageData.Plague.stages.1.label: major
LanguageData.Plague.stages.2.label: extreme
LanguageData.Plague.stages.3.label: extreme
LanguageData.Animal_Plague.label: plague
LanguageData.Animal_Plague.description: An infectious disease caused by bacteria. This strain is adapted to infecting non-human species.
LanguageData.Animal_Plague.stages.0.label: minor
LanguageData.Animal_Plague.stages.1.label: major
LanguageData.Animal_Plague.stages.2.label: extreme
LanguageData.Animal_Plague.stages.3.label: extreme
LanguageData.Malaria.label: malaria
LanguageData.Malaria.description: An infectious disease caused by a mosquito-borne parasite.
LanguageData.Malaria.stages.0.label: minor
LanguageData.Malaria.stages.1.label: major
LanguageData.Malaria.stages.2.label: extreme
LanguageData.SleepingSickness.label: sleeping sickness
LanguageData.SleepingSickness.description: An infectious disease caused by an insect-borne parasite. Sleeping sickness is not as deadly as some other diseases, but progresses slowly. The body takes a long time to clear the infection.
LanguageData.SleepingSickness.stages.0.label: minor
LanguageData.SleepingSickness.stages.1.label: minor
LanguageData.SleepingSickness.stages.2.label: major
LanguageData.SleepingSickness.stages.3.label: extreme
LanguageData.SleepingSickness.stages.4.label: extreme
LanguageData.MissingBodyPart.label: missing body part
LanguageData.MissingBodyPart.description: A body part is entirely missing.
LanguageData.Misc.label: misc
LanguageData.Burn.label: burn
LanguageData.ChemicalBurn.label: chemical burn
LanguageData.Crush.label: crush
LanguageData.Crack.label: crack
LanguageData.Cut.label: cut
LanguageData.SurgicalCut.label: surgical cut
LanguageData.ExecutionCut.label: cut
LanguageData.Scratch.label: scratch
LanguageData.Bite.label: bite
LanguageData.Stab.label: stab
LanguageData.Gunshot.label: gunshot
LanguageData.Shredded.label: shredded
LanguageData.Shredded.description: A part of the body has been shredded and torn.
LanguageData.Bruise.label: bruise
LanguageData.Frostbite.label: frostbite
LanguageData.Frostbite.description: Frozen tissue caused by exposure to cold without adequate protection. Frostbite is very painful, and frostbitten body parts are often lost.
LanguageData.TraumaSavant.label: trauma savant
LanguageData.TraumaSavant.description: An exceptional condition caused by trauma to the brain. The brain, in the face of injury, has developed extreme abilities in some areas, while losing the ability to speak.
LanguageData.ChemicalDamageModerate.label: chemical damage
LanguageData.ChemicalDamageModerate.description: Chemical damage at the cellular level.
LanguageData.ChemicalDamageSevere.label: chemical damage
LanguageData.ChemicalDamageSevere.description: Chemical damage at the cellular level.
LanguageData.Cirrhosis.label: cirrhosis
LanguageData.Cirrhosis.description: A degenerative liver disease caused by excessive alcohol consumption.
LanguageData.ResurrectionPsychosis.label: resurrection psychosis
LanguageData.ResurrectionPsychosis.description: Chaotic thought patterns caused by the decoherence of resurrection mechanites. Resurrection psychosis progresses and eventually causes total psychosis and death. \nResurrected people require mechanites to rebuild their bodily functions at the cellular level. Mechanites always have a chance to lose coherence, and if they do, they wreak havoc in the central nervous system. The older the corpse, the more mechanite action is required to resurrect it, and the greater the chance of eventual decoherence.
LanguageData.ResurrectionPsychosis.stages.0.label: early
LanguageData.ResurrectionPsychosis.stages.1.label: early
LanguageData.ResurrectionPsychosis.stages.2.label: moderate
LanguageData.ResurrectionPsychosis.stages.3.label: advanced
LanguageData.ResurrectionPsychosis.stages.4.label: severe
LanguageData.ResurrectionPsychosis.stages.5.label: total
LanguageData.ResurrectionPsychosis.stages.6.label: catatonic
LanguageData.Scaria.label: scaria
LanguageData.Scaria.description: A disease which causes affected creatures to enter berserk rages. A creature with scaria can be cured through a special medical operation, but it must be downed first. If not treated, scaria kills its host about five days after infection. The disease poisons the flesh and rots the skin, so creatures killed with scaria have a chance of rotting upon death so they cannot be butchered for meat or leather.
LanguageData.Sterilized.label: sterilized
LanguageData.Sterilized.description: This creature's reproductive system has been permanently shut down.
LanguageData.SandInEyes.label: sand
LanguageData.SandInEyes.description: Sand in the eyes. It impairs vision, but can be cleared within a few moments.
LanguageData.DirtInEyes.label: dirt
LanguageData.DirtInEyes.description: Dirt in the eyes. It impairs vision, but can be cleared in a few moments.
LanguageData.MudInEyes.label: mud
LanguageData.MudInEyes.description: Mud in the eyes. It impairs vision, but can be cleared in a few moments.
LanguageData.GravelInEyes.label: gravel
LanguageData.GravelInEyes.description: Gravel in the eyes. It impairs vision, but can be cleared in a few moments.
LanguageData.WaterInEyes.label: water
LanguageData.WaterInEyes.description: Water in the eyes. It impairs vision, but can be cleared in a few moments.
LanguageData.ArchotechEye.label: archotech eye
LanguageData.ArchotechArm.label: archotech arm
LanguageData.ArchotechArm.comps.0.tools.0.label: fist
LanguageData.ArchotechLeg.label: archotech leg
LanguageData.BionicEye.label: bionic eye
LanguageData.BionicArm.label: bionic arm
LanguageData.BionicArm.comps.0.tools.0.label: fist
LanguageData.BionicLeg.label: bionic leg
LanguageData.BionicSpine.label: bionic spine
LanguageData.BionicHeart.label: bionic heart
LanguageData.BionicStomach.label: bionic stomach
LanguageData.DeathAcidifier.label: death acidifier
LanguageData.BionicEar.label: bionic ear
LanguageData.BionicTongue.label: bionic tongue
LanguageData.PegLeg.label: peg leg
LanguageData.WoodenHand.label: wooden hand
LanguageData.WoodenFoot.label: wooden foot
LanguageData.Denture.label: denture
LanguageData.SimpleProstheticLeg.label: prosthetic leg
LanguageData.SimpleProstheticArm.label: prosthetic arm
LanguageData.SimpleProstheticHeart.label: prosthetic heart
LanguageData.CochlearImplant.label: cochlear implant
LanguageData.PowerClaw.label: power claw
LanguageData.PowerClaw.comps.0.tools.0.label: claw
LanguageData.Joywire.label: joywire
LanguageData.Painstopper.label: painstopper
